channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A 'Jane Doe' in the R. Kelly trials is ready to share her real name. And her story
item.description: A once anonymous R. Kelly survivor, Reshona Landfair is now ready to reclaim her voice.
item.content:encoded:
A once anonymous R. Kelly survivor, Reshona Landfair is now ready to reclaim her voice.

(Image credit: Grand Central Publishing)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Their film was shot in secret and smuggled out of Iran. It won an award at Sundance
item.description: Between war, protests and government crackdowns, the filmmakers raced to finish and smuggle their portrait of Tehran's underground arts scene to the prestigious film festival.
item.content:encoded:
at the Sundance Film Festival.'/>

Between war, protests and government crackdowns, the filmmakers raced to finish and smuggle their portrait of Tehran's underground arts scene to the prestigious film festival.

(Image credit: Mandalit del Barco)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: 'More relevant every day' in the U.S.: A filmmaker documented Russia's journalists
item.description: Julia Loktev's documentary My Undesirable Friends follows young independent journalists covering Putin's invasion of Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: Julia Loktev's documentary My Undesirable Friends follows young independent journalists covering Putin's invasion of Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: How the new dietary guidelines could impact school meals
item.description: Cutting back on ready-to-eat meals won't be easy, and whole milk may make a comeback. One thing that's certain: It'll be a while before the new guidelines trickle down to schools.
item.content:encoded: Cutting back on ready-to-eat meals won't be easy, and whole milk may make a comeback. One thing that's certain: It'll be a while before the new guidelines trickle down to schools.
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: A group of mudlarkers see what's hiding by a Philadelphia creek
item.description: "Mudlarking" is the hobby of searching for keepsakes along muddy creek banks. An old marble is enough to get people outdoors for this pursuit best performed in the winter.
item.content:encoded: "Mudlarking" is the hobby of searching for keepsakes along muddy creek banks. An old marble is enough to get people outdoors for this pursuit best performed in the winter.
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla

item.title: Reporter's notebook: A peek inside the Olympic Village
item.description: NPR reporters visited the Milan Olympic Village in the days before the opening ceremony to investigate the dining hall dessert situation and other pressing questions.
item.content:encoded:
NPR reporters visited the Milan Olympic Village in the days before the opening ceremony to investigate the dining hall dessert situation and other pressing questions.

(Image credit: Rachel Treisman)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: You owe it to yourself to go on a solo trip. Here's how to plan one
item.description: Traveling on your own can be scary, but it can be one of the most meaningful things you can do for yourself. Three solo travelers share their experiences — and what makes for a successful trip.
item.content:encoded: Traveling on your own can be scary, but it can be one of the most meaningful things you can do for yourself. Three solo travelers share their experiences — and what makes for a successful trip.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Edelman

item.title: The Winter Olympics are upon us. Here's how to follow along
item.description: The Winter Olympics bring hundreds of the world's best winter athletes to northern Italy, where they will face off in 16 different sports across 2 1/2 weeks. Here's how to follow along.
item.content:encoded:
The Winter Olympics bring hundreds of the world's best winter athletes to northern Italy, where they will face off in 16 different sports across 2 1/2 weeks. Here's how to follow along.

(Image credit: Maja Hitij)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Disney names Josh D'Amaro as its new CEO
item.description: D'Amaro will take over next month from Bob Iger, who has led the company for nearly two decades.
item.content:encoded:
D'Amaro will take over next month from Bob Iger, who has led the company for nearly two decades.

(Image credit: Ricardo Moreira/Getty Images for Disney
)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Award winning poet Kimberly M. Blaeser combines science and spirituality
item.description: Kimberly Blaeser, a former poet laureate of Wisconsin, will accept a prize from the National Book Foundation next month for her collection of poems, Ancient Light.
item.content:encoded: Kimberly Blaeser, a former poet laureate of Wisconsin, will accept a prize from the National Book Foundation next month for her collection of poems, Ancient Light.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby
